column4: My network speed seems to be capped at ~300k, I tried another NIC, already disabled ipv6. Nothing helps. I read a couple of posts about probs with the new 2.6 kernel so i upgraded to dapper, no help. Can anyone help me?
what kind of network are you connected to, and how?
i am on my home netwerk, using a router. Any other machine in the house has normal connection speeds. It's a wired 100mbit full duplex connection
yes, a 3com. Also tried a realtek
are you using CAT5 cable? Tried switching that?
dmesg sais that it loaded:  3Com PCI 3c905C
it's cat5 cable, but there is also no packet loss
is it connected to the same point as the machines that have normal speed?
every othermachine in the house uses wireless... they outperform wired at the moment
what's at the other end of the patch cable?
at the other end there is a drayteck vigor 2600G router.
so that shouldn't normally give any problems
have you tried connecting another machine to that router via a cable?
thanx so far btw. I am going to test the same cable using my notebook. So i'm going offline from this machine. I'll be back in a couple of mins
i had it installed, and then how should config the php.ini file. I only find info about it on windows, but not on linux.
skarface: I'll have a try first. Thank you.
